Problem:
Analyze a mechanical system in a complex plane under the influence of an external force and initial conditions. The position of a particle in the complex plane is described by the equation \\(z(t) = u(t) + iv(t)\\), where \\(u(t)\\) and \\(v(t)\\) represent the real and imaginary components of the position, respectively, in time t. The position is further affected by the transformation \\(h(z) = e^{i\\omega t}z\\), where \\(\\omega\\) is a constant.

Having observed the position \\(z(t)\\) at t = T, is it possible to infer the initial position \\(z_0\\) without knowing whether \\(h(z)\\) was applied at t = 0?
Explanation: Without knowledge of whether the transformation \\(h(z)\\) was applied, the initial condition could be one of multiple possible states resulting from different angular displacements imparted by the transformation \\(e^{i\\omega t}\\), complicating backward calculation to \\(z_0\\).
